liushuyu has marked this topic as resolved.
Note that you do need to propose the target, and respond to the target tier policy requirements for tier 3. You just don't need to meet any requirement for widespread use or popularity.

Josh Triplett said:

Note that you do need to propose the target, and respond to the target tier policy requirements for tier 3. You just don't need to meet any requirement for widespread use or popularity.

I see. How should I propose this target? Should I follow the MCP process or just open a normal issue? The documentation does not seem to explain the proposal part very well.
For a tier 2 or 1 target, you need an MCP. For a tier 3 target, I think it'd suffice to file a PR and post a message full-quoting the requirements and responding to them.

Josh Triplett said:

For a tier 2 or 1 target, you need an MCP. For a tier 3 target, I think it'd suffice to file a PR and post a message full-quoting the requirements and responding to them.

Ah, I see. I posted an MCP (https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/472) since I saw there were other cases where Tier 3 target filed an MCP.
It's not wrong to file an MCP, it just isn't a hard requirement.

Josh Triplett said:
